sense.name: Utter meaningless sounds, as a baby might; utter something incomprehensible.
sense.examples: That old man babbles all the time. The baby babbled at his mother. The two women babbled and crooned at the youngster. What are you babbling on about?

sense.name: Flow in an irregular current with a bubbling noise.
sense.commentary: Note: Be careful of adjectival uses.
sense.examples: The creek babbles from one town to the next.

sense.name: Divulge confidential information or secrets.
sense.commentary: Note: Compare to Sense 1; in Sense 3, the babbling produces truth-conditional semantic utterances.
sense.examples: Be careful - his secretary babbles! Don't babble a word to anyone!
